Description: Status of Building indicated by the type of Permit received.
Classification of building based on its main usage.
Indicates a secondary usage of a building, if a building has multiple usages.
The extent or range of judicial, law-enforcement, or other authority.
The organization that leases and/or manages the building. Examples of values include: UBCPT (UBC Properties Trust), Parking, UNA (University Neighbourhoods Association), TransLink, Non-UBC.
Physical state of the occupancy in the building.
Classification of building based on construction material type.
True if this building is a parent to sub-buildings.
Classification of building based on the form of the structure.

Facility Condition Index (FCI) score reflects the current condition of the building based on the total cost of needed building repairs and renewal divided by the current cost of replacing the building.

The Rick Hansen Foundation Accessibility CertificationTM (RHFAC) is a rating system that uses trained professionals to evaluate the meaningful access of commercial, institutional, and multi-unit residential buildings and sites.
Unique ID of the building.
Official name of the building.
2-5 character short form of building name, either the acronym of building name or derived from building name. Building Code for academic buildings may be used as classroom codes where applicable.
The date on which Occupancy Permit was issued.

Identify which program and at what level of certification a building has achieved. Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) is for academic buildings and the Residential Environmental Assessment Program (REAP) is for residential neighbourhood buildings.
Total floors above and below grade.

The sum of all horizontal areas of each storey within the exterior stud face of all exterior and basement walls. See UBC Development Handbook Section 3.3: Building Area, for full list of inclusions and exclusions.
A semicolon delimited list of record IDs are part of this building.
Source of building footprint geometry. As-built, orthophoto, etc.
